channel.title: BBC News - Wales

item.title: Sexism in the workplace: Women scared to speak out in NHS
item.description: A recent report found about 91% of female doctors in the UK had experienced sexism at work.

item.title: Blaenavon fire: Crews tackle large blaze at recycling plant
item.description: Residents in the area were told to keep doors and windows shut due to a large smoke plume.

item.title: Belarus 2-3 Wales: Gareth Bale scores hat-trick in World Cup qualifier
item.description: Gareth Bale scores a match-winning hat-trick to save Wales from an embarrassing defeat against Belarus and keep alive their hopes of qualifying for the World Cup.

item.title: Covid: Ceredigion towns' roads reopen as extra space scheme ends
item.description: Roads which closed to give extra space to pedestrians and businesses in Ceredigion are reopened.

item.title: Borth fire: No-one injured but animals killed
item.description: Neighbouring properties were evacuated and a major incident was declared.

item.title: Tom Hardy: Can a star's posts give locations a tourism boost?
item.description: Tom Hardy, Lin-Manuel Miranda and Forest Whitaker have all been seen enjoying Wales while filming.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics and Paralympics: How the Welsh athletes did at Tokyo 2020
item.description: BBC Sport Wales looks back at the Welsh medal winners at the Tokyo Olympic and Paralympic Games

item.title: Man in hospital after being hit by car on A465 near Neath
item.description: A pedestrian was involved in a collision with a Ford Fiesta, police say.

item.title: Green Man: 70 Covid cases linked to Brecon Beacons festival
item.description: The cases are "not necessarily attributable" to transmission at the festival, Public Health Wales says.

item.title: Man, 61, found dead in Barry home was 'peaceful and loving'
item.description: A man has been arrested on suspicion of murder following the death of Robert Farley, 61.

item.title: Man arrested after woman found unconscious in Tonyrefail
item.description: The 33-year-old woman has been taken to hospital with serious injuries, police say.

item.title: Awel y Môr: Consultation for wind farm off Wales' coast launched
item.description: About 100 turbines could be constructed, with the ability to power 900,000 homes.

item.title: Firefighters tackle large Blaenavon recycling plant blaze
item.description: Residents living nearby have been advised to keep windows and doors closed due to smoke.

item.title: Covid, Brexit and driver shortage blamed for bin collection delays
item.description: Some residents are complaining that rubbish has been left on their streets for weeks.

item.title: Borth fire: Flames and black smoke billow from blaze
item.description: The fire broke out in a three-storey property with 30 firefighters trying to stop it spreading.

item.title: Tokyo Olympians welcomed home to Ystrad Mynach and Blackwood
item.description: Boxing gold medallist Lauren Price said it was "amazing" to give back to their home towns.

item.title: Covid: Diary records how pandemic changed care home life
item.description: A former journalist writes a diary of his experiences during lockdown, including being in hospital.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: 15-year-old Cardiff sprinter with big dreams
item.description: Sprinter Tomi Roberts-Jones has cerebral palsy and, aged 15, has already represented Wales.

item.title: Tanni Grey-Thompson column: 'Great moments in Tokyo but Para-sport faces challenges'
item.description: Baroness Tanni Grey-Thompson reflects on Great Britain's performance at the Tokyo Paralympics and what comes next for Para-sport.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Memorable moments from the Games
item.description: BBC Sport looks back at 10 memorable moments from the Tokyo Paralympic Games.

item.title: Gareth Bale: I never planned to retire, says Wales and Real Madrid star
item.description: Gareth Bale says he "never planned" to retire as he aims to put doubts about his future to one side and lead Wales to a first World Cup since 1958.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Great Britain 'rewrote the history books' in Japan
item.description: Great Britain's Paralympics team has "rewritten the history books" with their performance in Tokyo, says chef de mission Penny Briscoe.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Great Britain finish Games with two more bronze medals
item.description: Great Britain win two bronze medals on the final day of the Tokyo Paralympics to finish second in the medal table.

item.title: Cwpan y Byd 2022: Belarws 2-3 Cymru
item.description: Gareth Bale yn sicrhau buddugoliaeth i Gymru yn erbyn Belarws yn rowndiau rhagbrofol Cwpan y Byd.

item.title: 'Merched yn y byd meddygol yn cael eu bychanu'n aml'
item.description: Dywedodd 88% o feddygon Cymru bod rhagfarn ar sail rhyw yn digwydd yn y Gwasanaeth Iechyd.

item.title: Amddiffyn penderfyniad i gynnal Hanner Marathon Môn
item.description: Dros fil o oedolion a phlant wedi cystadlu yn y ras er cynnydd diweddar yng nghyfraddau coronafeirws.

item.title: Asado: Dod â'r arfer Archentaidd o goginio cig i Gaernarfon
item.description: Yr Archentwr a'r canwr Billy Hughes sydd wedi dysgu'r cofi o Gaernarfon, Michael Downey sut i wneud Asado.

item.title: Cwpan y Byd 2022: Cymru i herio Belarws yn Rwsia heb 13 chwaraewr
item.description: Cymru heb 13 chwaraewr ar gyfer gêm ragbrofol Cwpan y Byd yn erbyn Belarws yn Rwsia ddydd Sul.
